page.title: 09AN IXWORTH DOCTOR'S MORNING
page.content: Awoken at 6.30 by emergency call to a patient with a severe asthmatic attack. Returned home to shower and have breakfast, then went to the Health Centre to prepare for morning surgery. After disussing current serious problems with partners and making and receiving telephone calls, morning surgery commenced at 9.00. Left surgery at 10.15 to attend a patient suffering a heart attack and arranged his transfer to the Coronary Care Unit at West Suffolk Hospital. Returned to surgery to continue consultations, then went on to branch surgery.11.45 surgery completed, a total of 22 patients had been seen.Mail was dealt with, a quick coffee drunk then home visits began. Two were undertaken before lunch and three after.
